Tasks.Task Description: Identify the analytics requirements, data sources, and expected outcomes for the Azure Data Lake Storage project.
Determine the volume, velocity, and variety of data to be stored and analyzed. Identify the required storage tier and performance needs.
Plan the structure of the data lake, including folder hierarchy, naming conventions, and access patterns for analytics workloads.
Create the Azure Data Lake Storage account and configure the required settings, such as performance tier and redundancy options.
Set up access controls, encryption, and firewall rules to secure the data lake. Configure Azure Active Directory (AAD) for authentication.
Connect the data lake to various data sources, such as on-premises databases, Azure services, and third-party applications.
Set up pipelines using Azure Data Factory or other tools to ingest data into the data lake. Ensure data is ingested in the required format and frequency.
Implement best practices for data partitioning and compression to improve query performance and reduce storage costs.
Integrate analytics tools such as Azure Synapse Analytics, Databricks, or Power BI with the data lake for data processing and visualization.
Configure monitoring tools such as Azure Monitor to track data lake performance, storage usage, and access patterns. Set up alerts for anomalies.
Perform end-to-end testing of the data lake, including data ingestion, storage, security, and analytics workflows.
Create detailed documentation for the data lake architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Share with relevant stakeholders.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing, monitoring, and troubleshooting the data lake setup.
Ensure the data lake complies with regulatory requirements and implement governance policies for data access and usage.
